task.title: Better error response for wrong datetime format in REST filter

data.title: Better error response for wrong datetime format in REST filter
data.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
We recently merged <https://github.com/qdrant/qdrant/pull/3395> which adds a datetime payload index.

Currently, the datetime parser is very strict, only allowing [RFC 3339](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3339) formats in our REST API. A common format such as `YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS` is currently not accepted.

If you'd send the following request:

```json
POST collections/test_collection/points/scroll
{
  "limit": 10,
  "filter": {
    "must": [
      {
        "key": "updated",
        "datetime_range": {
          "gt": "2014-01-01T00:00:00"
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

You'd receive the following error:

```
Format error in JSON body: data did not match any variant of untagged enum Condition at line 1 column 96
```

This error is very confusing.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
We'd strongly prefer a more descriptive error message instead.

Something like this would be a lot better:

```
Format error in JSON body: '2014-01-01T00:00:00' does not match any accepted datetime format
```

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
_None_

**Additional context**
Related issue: <https://github.com/qdrant/qdrant/issues/3529>

task.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
We recently merged <https://github.com/qdrant/qdrant/pull/3395> which adds a datetime payload index.

Currently, the datetime parser is very strict, only allowing [RFC 3339](https://www.rfc-editor.org/rfc/rfc3339) formats in our REST API. A common format such as `YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS` is currently not accepted.

If you'd send the following request:

```json
POST collections/test_collection/points/scroll
{
  "limit": 10,
  "filter": {
    "must": [
      {
        "key": "updated",
        "datetime_range": {
          "gt": "2014-01-01T00:00:00"
        }
      }
    ]
  }
}
```

You'd receive the following error:

```
Format error in JSON body: data did not match any variant of untagged enum Condition at line 1 column 96
```

This error is very confusing.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
We'd strongly prefer a more descriptive error message instead.

Something like this would be a lot better:

```
Format error in JSON body: '2014-01-01T00:00:00' does not match any accepted datetime format
```

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
_None_

**Additional context**
Related issue: <https://github.com/qdrant/qdrant/issues/3529>

task.title: Per-collection metrics for Prometheus

data.title: Per-collection metrics for Prometheus
data.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

Currently, all metrics in `/metrics` are global, meaning that itâ€™s impossible to see differences per collection.

In addition to that, all our metrics should have per-collection granularity to allow better aggregation in Prometheus, including:

- point/vector counts
- REST/gRPC requests

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Example:
```
grpc_responses_min_duration_seconds{endpoint="/qdrant.Points/Upsert"} 0.000046
grpc_responses_min_duration_seconds{endpoint="/qdrant.Points/Upsert",collection="my-collection"} 0.000049
grpc_responses_min_duration_seconds{endpoint="/qdrant.Points/Upsert",collection="my-collection-2"} 0.000046
```

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

Create dedicated endpoint for each collection `/collections/my-collecton/metrics`
but feedback from DevOps on this idea was negative.

**Additional context**

It might be beneficial to allow users to disable per-collection output. It is especially relevant if there are a lot of collections and metric response could become huge. But this is a nice-to-have requirement.


---

Note for contributors: Please consider this as tracking issue. If you think that it would be beneficial to split the task into multiple smaller PRs, please you are welcome to do so. Bounty will be rewarded for each PR independently

task.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**

Currently, all metrics in `/metrics` are global, meaning that itâ€™s impossible to see differences per collection.

In addition to that, all our metrics should have per-collection granularity to allow better aggregation in Prometheus, including:

- point/vector counts
- REST/gRPC requests

**Describe the solution you'd like**

Example:
```
grpc_responses_min_duration_seconds{endpoint="/qdrant.Points/Upsert"} 0.000046
grpc_responses_min_duration_seconds{endpoint="/qdrant.Points/Upsert",collection="my-collection"} 0.000049
grpc_responses_min_duration_seconds{endpoint="/qdrant.Points/Upsert",collection="my-collection-2"} 0.000046
```

**Describe alternatives you've considered**

Create dedicated endpoint for each collection `/collections/my-collecton/metrics`
but feedback from DevOps on this idea was negative.

**Additional context**

It might be beneficial to allow users to disable per-collection output. It is especially relevant if there are a lot of collections and metric response could become huge. But this is a nice-to-have requirement.


---

Note for contributors: Please consider this as tracking issue. If you think that it would be beneficial to split the task into multiple smaller PRs, please you are welcome to do so. Bounty will be rewarded for each PR independently

task.title: Problem: omni_schema.dependency and omni_schema.acl views are slow

data.title: Problem: omni_schema.dependency and omni_schema.acl views are slow
data.body:
This gravely impacts some of our functionality like schema diffing as we scan through all these views and `dependency` and `acl` views are the worst offenders.

Proposed solution: find a way to significantly optimize the queries

One thing is to see what else can be done for the queries themselves â€“ at the very least in `dependency` and `acl` and maybe even other meta views. 

https://github.com/omnigres/omnigres/blob/master/extensions/omni_schema/src/meta/catalog.sql#L76

task.title: CVE-2024-3408 - man-group/dtale - Authentication Bypass & Remote Code Execution ðŸ’°

data.title: CVE-2024-3408 - man-group/dtale - Authentication Bypass & Remote Code Execution ðŸ’°
data.body:
### Description: 
> man-group/dtale 3.10.0 contains an authentication bypass and remote code execution caused by improper input validation and a hardcoded SECRET_KEY in Flask configuration, letting attackers forge session cookies and execute arbitrary code, exploit requires attacker to access the application.

#### Severity: `Critical`

#### POC: 
- https://huntr.com/bounties/57a06666-ff85-4577-af19-f3dfb7b02f91
- https://github.com/rapid7/metasploit-framework/blob/master/modules/exploits/linux/http/dtale_rce_cve_2025_0655.rb

### KEV: True

### Shodan Query: `NA`

> Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(`-debug`) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file. 

> Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program [here](https://github.com/projectdiscovery/nuclei-templates/blob/main/Community-Rewards-FAQ.md).

data.title: CVE-2012-10018 - Mapplic & Mapplic Lite - Server Side Request Forgery & Stored XSS ðŸ’°
data.body:
### Description: 
> Mapplic and Mapplic Lite WordPress plugins versions up to 6.1 and 1.0 contain a server-side request forgery caused by insufficient validation, letting attackers forge requests from the server and perform an XSS attack if requesting an SVG file.

#### Severity: `High`

#### POC: 
- https://packetstormsecurity.com/files/161919/
- https://packetstormsecurity.com/files/161920/

task.title: CVE-2017-18365 - GitHub Enterprise - Insecure Deserialization ðŸ’°

data.title: CVE-2017-18365 - GitHub Enterprise - Insecure Deserialization ðŸ’°
data.body:
### Description: 
> GitHub Enterprise 2.8.x before 2.8.7 contains a deserialization caused by a static enterprise session secret in the Management Console, letting unauthenticated attackers execute arbitrary code, exploit requires crafting a signed cookie with the secret.

#### Severity: `Critical`

#### POC: 
- https://www.exablue.de/blog/2017-03-15-github-enterprise-remote-code-execution.html
- https://github.com/rapid7/metasploit-framework/blob/master/modules/exploits/linux/http/github_enterprise_secret.rb

### KEV: True

### Shodan Query: `http.title:"github debug"`

> Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(`-debug`) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file. 

> Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. task.title: CVE-2019-8978 - Ellucian Banner - Broken Authentication ðŸ’°

task.title: CVE-2019-3980 - Solarwinds Dameware Mini Remote Client - Remote Code Execution ðŸ’°

data.title: CVE-2019-3980 - Solarwinds Dameware Mini Remote Client - Remote Code Execution ðŸ’°
data.body:
### Description: 
> Solarwinds Dameware Mini Remote Client agent v12.1.0.89 contains a remote code execution caused by support for smart card authentication allowing upload and execution of arbitrary executables on the host, letting unauthenticated attackers execute code under the Local System account, exploit requires requesting smart card login.

#### Severity: `Critical`

#### POC: 
- https://www.tenable.com/security/research/tra-227-43
- https://github.com/CyberQuestor-infosec/CVE-2019-3980-Open_Net_Admin_v18.1.1_RCE
- https///github.com:CyberQuestor-infosec/CVE-2019-3980-Open_Net_Admin_v18.1.1_RCE.git
- https://github.com/Barbarisch/CVE-2019-3980
- https://vulncheck.com/xdb/b2d525559d87
- https///github.com:Barbarisch/CVE-2019-3980.git
- https://github.com/warferik/CVE-2019-3980

### KEV: True

### Shodan Query: `NA`

> Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(`-debug`) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

task.title: CVE-2019-18935 - Progress Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX - Insecure Deserialization ðŸ’°

data.title: CVE-2019-18935 - Progress Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX - Insecure Deserialization ðŸ’°
data.body:
### Description: 
> Progress Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX <= 2019.3.1023 contains a .NET deserialization caused by insecure RadAsyncUpload function, letting attackers with known encryption keys execute remote code, exploit requires known encryption keys or specific settings.

#### Severity: `Critical`

#### POC: 
- http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/159653/Telerik-UI-ASP.NET-AJAX-RadAsyncUpload-Deserialization.html
- https://github.com/bao7uo/RAU_crypto
- https://github.com/noperator/CVE-2019-18935
- https://know.bishopfox.com/research/cve-2019-18935-remote-code-execution-in-telerik-ui
- https://github.com/rapid7/metasploit-framework/blob/master/modules/exploits/windows/http/telerik_rau_deserialization.rb
- https://github.com/menashe12346/CVE-2019-18935
- https///github.com:menashe12346/CVE-2019-18935.git
- https://github.com/quyt0/CVE-2019-18935-exploit-study
- https///github.com:quyt0/CVE-2019-18935-exploit-study.git
- https///github.com:hnytgl/TelerikUI-RCE.git
- https://github.com/0xsharz/telerik-scanner-CVE-2019-18935
- https://github.com/ekkoo-z/CVE-2019-18935-bypasswaf
- https///github.com:ekkoo-z/CVE-2019-18935-bypasswaf.git
- https://vulncheck.com/xdb/c621c71a9bf3
- https://github.com/clarkvoss/telerik
- https///github.com:clarkvoss/telerik.git
- https://github.com/dust-life/CVE-2019-18935-memShell
- https://github.com/KasunPriyashan/Telerik-UI-ASP.NET-AJAX-Exploitation
- https://vulncheck.com/xdb/dffdf06b5f8a
- https://github.com/0xAgun/CVE-2019-18935-checker
- https///github.com:0xAgun/CVE-2019-18935-checker.git
- https://github.com/random-robbie/CVE-2019-18935
- https://vulncheck.com/xdb/dd4d5145d7fd
- https://github.com/appliedi/Telerik_CVE-2019-18935
- https///github.com:appliedi/Telerik_CVE-2019-18935.git

task.body:
### Description: 
> Progress Telerik UI for ASP.NET AJAX <= 2019.3.1023 contains a .NET deserialization caused by insecure RadAsyncUpload function, letting attackers with known encryption keys execute remote code, exploit requires known encryption keys or specific settings.

#### Severity: `Critical`

#### POC: 
- http://packetstormsecurity.com/files/159653/Telerik-UI-ASP.NET-AJAX-RadAsyncUpload-Deserialization.html

data.title: CVE-2020-14756 - Oracle Coherence - Remote Code Execution ðŸ’°
data.body:
### Description: 
> Oracle Coherence of Oracle Fusion Middleware (versions 3.7.1.0, 12.1.3.0.0, 12.2.1.3.0, 12.2.1.4.0, 14.1.1.0.0) contains a remote code execution caused by unauthenticated network access via IIOP and T3, letting attackers compromise the system, exploit requires network access.

#### Severity: `Critical`

#### POC:

task.title: CVE-2021-21980 - vSphere Web Client - Path Traversal ðŸ’°

data.title: CVE-2021-21980 - vSphere Web Client - Path Traversal ðŸ’°
data.body:
### Description: 
> vSphere Web Client (FLEX/Flash) contains an unauthorized arbitrary file read caused by insecure file access in the web client, letting attackers with network access to port 443 on vCenter Server access sensitive information, exploit requires network access to port 443.

#### Severity: `High`

#### POC: 
- https://github.com/Osyanina/westone-CVE-2022-1388-scanner
- https://github.com/Osyanina/westone-CVE-2021-21980-scanner

task.title: Make sure kicad component components create courtyards

data.title: Make sure kicad component components create courtyards
data.body:
In https://kicad-component.tscircuit.com / https://github.com/tscircuit/kicad-component-converter

We need to load the kicad_mod file and produce `<courtyardrect />` elements

- [ ] Find a kicad_mod file to test with that has a courtyard defined
- [ ] Make sure courtyards are drawn in circuit-to-svg
- [ ] Modify kicad-component-converter
- [ ] Modify circuit-json-to-tscircuit


/bounty $75

task.title: Proposal: Add SparkFun MicroMod STM32 Processor (STM32F405)

data.title: Proposal: Add SparkFun MicroMod STM32 Processor (STM32F405)
data.body:
Title
Proposal: Add SparkFun MicroMod STM32 Processor (STM32F405)

Body
Hi TSCircuit team! Iâ€™d like to propose adding the SparkFun MicroMod STM32 Processor to the funboards catalog.

- Board: SparkFun MicroMod STM32 Processor (STM32F405RGT6)
- Product page: https://www.sparkfun.com/products/21326
- Hardware repo: https://github.com/sparkfun/MicroMod_STM32_Processor
- Hookup guide: https://learn.sparkfun.com/tutorials/micromod-stm32-processor-hookup-guide
- Schematic (PDF): https://cdn.sparkfun.com/assets/8/a/a/7/3/MicroMod_STM32_Processor.pdf

Why this board
- Expands MicroMod coverage (M.2 â€œE-classâ€ 22mm edge) and brings STM32F4 (Cortex-M4) into the catalog.
- Reusable mapping: once the MicroMod edge connector + STM32F405 pins are modeled, other MicroMod processors benefit.
- Complexity: moderate/advanced (MCU, HSE/LSE clocks, boot/reset gating, SPI flash, SDIO, USB, SWD). Seems like a mid-tier bounty candidate.

Duplication check
- I checked the public boards list in `tscircuit/sparkfun-boards/boards/` and did not find this board at time of filing.
- Also glanced at the org project board (https://github.com/orgs/tscircuit/projects/6) and didnâ€™t see it in progress. Please correct me if I missed it.

Planned implementation (TSX; no XY tooling)
- Schematic (TSX):
  - `STM32F405RG` (LQFP-64) with VDDx/VDDA/VSSA, `VCAP1/2` decoupling, `PH0/PH1` 12MHz HSE, `PC14/PC15` 32.768kHz LSE.
  - SPI flash W25Qxx (WSON-8 6x5) on SPI1 (PA5/PA6/PA7) + `PC4` CS#; HOLD#/WP# as per schematic.
  - MicroMod edge symbol with named pins: 3.3V, GNDs, `USB_DÂ±`, `USB_VIN`, `RTC_3V`, `3.3V_EN`, `!RESET!`, `!BOOT!`, SWDIO/SWCLK, SDIO, SPI, I2C, UART, BUS/GPIO.
  - Boot/reset: `BOOT0` gating via Pâ€‘MOSFET (DMG2305UXâ€‘7), RC on `NRST`, `PB2` (BOOT1) strapped.
- PCB (TSX):
  - 22mm MicroMod card outline with chamfer; custom edge pad footprint (pads 1â€“75) per MicroMod spec.
  - Place LQFPâ€‘64, crystals (3225/3215), WSONâ€‘8 flash, decoupling; indicative routing for visuals.
- Artifacts: snapshots/renders via `tsci snapshot`.

Acceptance/questions
- Can you confirm itâ€™s green to proceed and eligible for a bounty? If so, please attach a bounty and assign.
- Any preference for edge connector footprint naming or a canonical MicroMod footprint I should reuse?
- Any constraints (e.g., minimum visual fidelity for the edge connector, keepout notches, silk expectations)?
- Any components/modules to avoid for funboards? (Iâ€™ve avoided relying on XY import.)

Estimated effort
- 1â€“2 days for faithful schematic + functional PCB visualization (including custom edge footprint) and snapshots.

Thanks! Happy to adapt to preferred structure or scope.

Thanks! Happy to adapt to preferred structure or scope.
